Class SpellCheckEditor

java.lang.Object
main.java.text_editor.editors.Editor
main.java.text_editor.editors.SpellCheckEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Editable, Transformable
public class SpellCheckEditor extends Editor implements Transformable, Cloneable, Serializable
The SpellCheckEditor extends the base Editor class to provide spell checking capabilities. It maintains a dictionary of known words and can transform the text to highlight misspelled words by surrounding them with tilde (~) characters.

This class also provides word prediction functionality based on the current word being typed and the available dictionary.

Author:
Ugnius Tei≈°erskis

    • checkWord

      public boolean checkWord(String word)
      Checks if a word exists in the dictionary. The check is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to check
      Returns:
      true if the word exists in the dictionary, false otherwise

    • transform

      public void transform()
      Transforms the text by marking misspelled words. Words not found in the dictionary are surrounded by tilde (~) characters. Punctuation is preserved during the transformation.
      Specified by:
      transform in interface Transformable
      Specified by:
      transform in class Editor

    • getPredictions

      public List<String> getPredictions(int maxSuggestions)
      Gets a list of word predictions based on the current word being typed.
      Parameters:
      maxSuggestions - the maximum number of suggestions to return
      Returns:
      a list of predicted words that start with the current word prefix

    • getCurrentWord

      public String getCurrentWord()
      Gets the current word at the caret position. A word is defined as a sequence of letter or digit characters.
      Returns:
      the current word at the caret position, or an empty string if no word is found
